intro: Coppensia welteri, commonly known as the Welter's heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Coppensia welteri thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is a hardy species that is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
